properties.address: City Church Sheffield, Sheffield, South Yorkshire S11 8RN
properties.description: We run our Warm Space in the lower hall of our Church building. We have different areas for different activities plus a cafe area for just having a chat and a cuppa. Lunch is provided. All free of charge. You can join us for an hour or stay for the full opening time. We open our Warm Space most Fridays, please contact the office for upcoming dates or visit our website calendar at https://citychurchsheffield.org.uk/calendar/
properties.title: City Church Sheffield

properties.address: Common Ground Community Centre, Sheffield, Sheffield S7 IHA
properties.description: Welcome to our community lunch :) We warmly invite you to join us in the Common Ground Community Centre, in the warm main hall. Dates coming up: Dec 1st 2023, Dec 15th, Jan 12th 2024, Jan 26th, Feb 9th, Mar 1st, Mar 15th, Apr19th, May 3rd, May 17th, June 7th, June 21st, July 5th, July 19th. 12 - 2pm only on these Friday, eat in only. You can enter through the gate at the bottom of Woodstock Road (opposite Empire Hair!) We lay out long tables and people from across the community come to eat. There's space to sit on your own or people to sit next to if you prefer. Those on benefits / NRPF eat a delicious, authentic dhaal, rice and chutneys lunch for free, others are asked to 'pay as you feel'. It is a very warm and friendly atmosphere where diversity is welcomed and celebrated.
properties.title: Common Ground Community Centre

properties.address: Thorpe Hesley Library and Neighbourhood Hub @ Trinity Community Centre, Rotherham, South Yorkshire S61 2QJ
properties.description: Small, friendly Library within a community centre. Despite the rising cost of living, Rotherham Libraries and Neighbourhood Hubs will be offering a Warm Welcome at venues across the borough this winter. Our libraries are offering their warm and inviting spaces for residents to come and meet with friends and family, get involved in events and activities, or have time to themselves while checking out a library book. There is a vast array of activities and groups taking place at our Libraries, and these are free and open to all. The libraries will be open for residents to enjoy and join in activities during normal opening hours. You will be able to access a catalogue of books and get access to computers so you can access support and advice on the cost of living.
properties.title: Thorpe Hesley Library and Neighbourhood Hub

properties.address: Unit 2, 1 St James' Row, S1 2EU
properties.description: An Energy Hub that has a community room along with a kids table where they can play some games on the available tablets or do some colouring in. We serve hot drinks and run Energy Efficiency workshops, to show how you can save money on your household bills.

properties.title: Inclusion in Action

properties.address: Manor Training & Resource Centre, 304-308 Prince of Wales Road, Manor, Sheffield, S2 1FF
properties.description: Over the colder winter months, we understand that many people face fuel poverty and struggle to afford heating costs. This is why we have funded a number of Warm hubs that can support people during the cost-of-living crisis. Warm hubs provide a safe place which is warm, friendly and welcoming where attendees can partake in social activities surrounded by the company of others whilst receiving support during difficult times. They offer a lifeline for people in social isolation and those suffering with fuel poverty. MaTReC run a community café serving affordable meals and drinks, as well as a Digital Café where customers can access iPads. We have partnered with the MaTReC Warm hub to fund a weekly luncheon club to provide free meals to the community as well as a weekly coffee morning.
properties.title: MaTReC Warm Hub - Sheffield

properties.address: Herdings Community and Heritage Centre, Morland Road, Sheffield, S14 1TD
properties.description: During the cost of living crisis we understand more people need help for essential food, therefore Places for People have donated to various foodbank across the country to help our customers and other individuals in the community. Over the colder winter months, the Foodbank will also act as a Warm hub, providing a safe place which is warm, friendly and welcoming. They offer a lifeline for people in social isolation and those suffering with fuel poverty.
properties.title: Herdings Community Café & Warm Hub
